Very Good :D

This game has a great story in single player mode and really great co-op mode as well. The in game map maker is one of the best I have ever seen and you can publish to Steam-Works which adds a ton of value to this game. Get it you will be glad you did.

-------------- Portal 2 ---------------
Graphics & Audio:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Portal 2's visuals is one of the strengths of the game. High tech machines working nearby, inmense descruction surrounding you, and environment detail gives the eye candy that any high graphical gamer is seeking. In addition, the audio is well designed. From robotic voices to collapsing buildings, the audio in it will not disappoint you. 

Story:
~~~~~
Before reviewing the story, have in mind that I have not played Portal 1. I can not provide any helpful information that can link the 2 video games. For portal 2, however, I like to see the story from two different perspectives. The main plot is well designed and written, the side characters are well developed, and the humor in it is done correctly. You will find the story itself quiet interesting and hilarious as you progress into the game. However, the overall setting is never explained. It will leave you wondering (not a whole lot) after completion of the game. 

Game-Play:
~~~~~~~~~
The game-play in portal 2 is very puzzling (really that's what the game is all about). If you come here expecting to have some shooting and action, you will not get it. Although you do encounter enemies on your way, it is not Portal 2's main purpose. It requires you to solve puzzles by creating portals that will allow you to teleport from one place to another. At times, you may believe that the game already has everything that it can possibly offer, but then you encounter new mechanics that make the puzzles crazier and more strategic. 

Other Things:
~~~~~~~~~~~
The online workshop adds on a lot of user created maps. Even after you complete the game, if you are still enjoying the puzzles, you can download plenty of user created maps. You can even create your own. It also allows you to complete puzzles with friends which adds on the puzzles' difficulty since it requires for both players to work togethere (Have in mind some friends won't easly cooperate with you!).

Overall:
~~~~~~
Portal 2 is an amazing game. Its first person and puzzle mechanics make it very unique. If you love puzzles, you are missing out on Portal 2. I personally recommend it, and if I could rate it. I would rate it a 9 out of 10.

I hope this review helps (It's my first review!).

Eu sempre sou cético com continuações, pois os riscos de ser apenas uma repetição dos jogos anteriores da franquia são altos. Portal 2 foi um dos poucos jogos que superou minhas expectativas. 
A ideia central do gameplay é a mesma, mas o fluxo é totalmente diferente. A história é imersiva e segue um fluxo muito divertido e é supreendente. Está ainda mais engraçado. 
Fazendo uma analogia, Portal 1 está para Half-Life 1 assim como Porta 2 está para Half-Life 2.

This game is what made me actually start to truely love games for what they are. What games are pieces of art. this piece of art is a master piece from the visual astetics, to the mind blowing story line. the characters are the most memorable of them all and the atmosphere is so sad and dreary it just pulls you in and you can't stop playing. i actually engaged in it and it brought me to a whole new world which was just quite the expirence. Also, the co-op is a blast to play with friends and to just mess around and have fun. i recomend this game to everyone cause anyone can get into it and if i may mention its gameplay is so so so so so so good! real thing for me that got me into though, was the characters and the atmosphere which i don't play games for those reasons, but this one made me. In short, just buy it.

I liked it but thinking with portals now means that I have so much trouble in the real world that it's making my life a living hell. I get to the bus stop and remember that I want to go into the shop across the road. Can I place a portal? Fucking no. I'm in the downstairs of my house and I run upstairs to get something, pick something up, forget the thing that I went up for and then run back downstairs. Can I place a portal? No. I want to go back and forth between my house and the local kebab shop. Portal placement possible? What do you think? Step it up, science. Necessity is the mother of invention, but laziness is the daddy. 4/10 for making me hate the world I live in.

Portal one and two are great, even when doing the same idea they add in some new mechanics to the game that really refresh the gameplay and make it a completely different entity from the first one. The only issue I have is the fact you can buy costumes and gestures in a microtransaction shop, which is a massive turn off (the microtransaction shop I mean).

DQSwordz's Review on Portal 2

So Portal 2:

Portal 2 is a sequel to the game Portal. The game is about your character (Chell) being stuck in the Aperture Science Laboratories,  you must find the famous gun named the Portal Gun. This isnt any old gun, this gun fires out orange and blue potarls these Portals transfer you to different places for example: if you fire a blue portal and fire a orange portal and walk through the blue portal, you will transport to the location of the orange portal. However, this game s not just about having fun with portals, Oh no, theres alot more to do. Your character has to do tests using the portal gun. These tests can be puzzling, but you will have to get through them! There is also a multiplayer option to this game, you and your friend can solve puzzles together, these puzzles can only be completed with your friend so you'll have to figure out what you have to do, and what your friend has to do. Depending on who is player 1 or 2 your characters are 2 different robots. Player 1 is the small robot named Atlas, and Player 2 is the tall robot named P-Body. Atlas has 2 differents shades of blue with his portal gun and P-Body has 2 different shades of orange with his portal gun. The singleplayer campaign is very fun (except for the puzzles that I mentioned earlier they can be frustrating but they can be fun also) the funniest part of the campaign is the voice actor for a small robot named Wheatly he has a really funny voice and says lots of funny things he is voice by Stephen Merchant. Anyway this game is very fun and exciting I would definately recommend it to all my friends and anyone else. 10/10 Because of... well baisically what I just said. This is a must buy! Thank you for reading my review. :) ~DQSwordz

Очень атмосферная и временами презабавная игра. Ещё не довелось сыграть в неё в кооперативном режиме. Но даже одиночная превзошла своего предшественника по всем пунктам. Более разнообразные головоломки. Панели вместо глухих стен очень порадовали. Интересен так же и редактор уровней. Удобный, лёгкий в освоении. Едиснтвенное НО, есть лимит по количеству объектов на уровне, но индикатора его использования нет, узнаёшь о перегрузе, только когда пытаешься пересобрать уровень. А в целом замечательная игра. Не говоря уж об огромном количестве тестовых камер от сообщества в мастерской.

UPD: после нескольких десятков часов в кооперативе, могу добавить, что это просто взрыв положительных эмоций. Не подкалывать и не кривляться просто невозможно. Головоломки намного сложнее и интереснее. Бегаешь с другом пол часа по камере пытаясь понять её суть, а потом на кого-нибудь вдруг снисходит озарение. И вот вы уже воодушевились и сделали как надо, а это не работает))

В общем, одиночная это классный сюжет, и огромная предыстория самой Aperture, а кооператив это бездонная бочка веселья.
